conclusion: To determine the state of the elevator at t=4.5s, analyze the acceleration.
The graph shows acceleration changes over time; at t=4.5s, acceleration is above 0 but below its value at t=0s.
The acceleration is positive at t=4.5s, indicating upward acceleration.
Positive acceleration means an apparent increase in weight due to the greater normal force needed for upward acceleration.
Since acceleration is positive and upwards at t=4.5s, the elevator is in a state of overload (superweight).
The elevator is in a state of overload (superweight) at t=4.5s.
